bioghist.p: Denis Conway and Thomas Scanlon were involved with the roof slate business in Germantown, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two ledgers of accounts, purchases, and receipts for the roof slate business of Denis Conway and Thomas Scanlon. The first volume covers the period 1850 to 1854. In this volume, alternating sections list payments to Scanlon and Conway for work slating houses and other buildings and disbursements and receipts for supplies and other expenses, including lists of slates purchased by Conway and Scanlon. The second volume, 1855 to 1866, includes payments made for labor, such as hauling of slates; lists of slates purchased; and accounts of payments received for labor. There is an 1865 letter inserted in the volume from Michael H. Quinn of the 3rd Pennsylvania Cavalry to his uncle describing a Civil War battle near Petersburg.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
